Text:
...Shadow Garden, huh? You just had to go out of your
way to stir up unnecessary trouble, didn't you?
I understand you were the one who led this attack.

Have you any excuse for the loss of so many of our
invaluable Templars?
...None. I take full responsibility.

Templars exercise the right of inquisition on a
rotating four-year basis, with the archbishops
of Orum serving as auditors.

As the one who leads the Templars, you know why it
works this way, do you not?

To...prevent the abuse of the right of inquisition
by the bishops of each diocese and the monopoly
on the right of inquisition by the Cult of Diablos.

Exactly. The reason why the Cult and the Church,
which emerged from the Cult, have each other's
backs is that the Church is in the position to
exercise the right of inquisition, not the Cult.
as guards, Victoria.

So, for the time being, I would like you to
concentrate on your usual role as a prophetess.
But!

The Templars' half-hearted intervention in this
incident and the fact that, despite the loss of your
troops, you returned unscathed...

...have given the Cult reason to once again call into
question our right of inquisition.
We acted to condemn the heretics! Bishop Drake—

A year and a half from now, I will be "Archbishop"
Drake, charged with the sacred ministry of the
cathedral in the Sacred Land of Lindwurm.

Therefore, I must ask you to refrain from exercising
your inquisitorial powers unnecessarily and dragging
me down with your failures due to my position as your
auditor.

...I may be under your watchful eye, but you are
under the watchful eye of Goddess Beatrix!
What did you just say?
...Nothing... My apologies.

...I'm afraid her purely devotional faith is working
against her, despite her knowing this is the way the
world is run.

She is the most talented and capable woman in the
Templars' history, but she has gained unnecessary
wisdom through her contact with the outside world.

I must withdraw her from the battlefield for the time
being, increase her dose of the secret drug, and let
her hear the mighty "voice of the Goddess..."
Heheh... Gamma... Found you.
Eta... I don't like the sound of that!

Just so we're clear, I'm not increasing your budget,
and I'm not going to be your guinea pig for any more
dangerous experiments!

I haven't said anything yet... Besides, neither of
those things is what I wanted to ask you about...

...That's sort of terrifying in its own way...
Well, how can I help you?
...Heheh.
Gamma, let's go look for oil together.
Oil? And did you just say "together"?

...Hold on. Could this "oil" be Shadow Wisdom that
Master Shadow told you about?
Yeah...
Oh... And what exactly is this thing called "oil"?
Hmm... Well...
...I-Incredible!

If we could find such a resource...say, an oil field,
it would transform this world's energy industry!

It would be the key to evolving this civilization to
no longer rely on magic...and a vital resource for
the Garden. I, too, am very, very interested...

So, Gamma, let's go look for oil together.
I've already got a good idea of where we
might find some...

Very well! After all, the word of Master Shadow takes
precedence over everything else!
...So, where exactly did you have in mind?
This here is Alexandria...
Yes. And this right here is Lindwurm—
And this over here is Midgar Kingdom.
...This is the City-State Alliance. And...
And...?
...Our destination is right here.
That's...the Velgalta Empire!

Well, it's in the Velgalta Empire...but where exactly
is that?

It seems to be far from the capital in the middle of
nowhere...
...Whew... We're finally here!

So, this is Madlid...located in a remote corner of
the Velgalta Empire!
